quizzes.title: History Quiz: Music and Period
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, composers, mood. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: It was typical for the music of this period to create atmosphere or a mood, describing nothing definite.  Lîsle Joyeuse (The Island of Joy) by Claude Debussy is a typical example of that, due to  the lack of characteristic themes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Impressionism

questions.question: The song Rescue Me was a huge hit song for this singer in 1965.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fontella Bass

questions.question: What instrument made these men famous: Vladimir Horowitz, Arthur Rubinstein, Sergei Rachmaninoff, and Glenn Gould.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Piano

questions.question: The music of this modern period combines some features from classical music with trends from the 20th century. Shostakovich appears to be among the most famous composers of the period.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neoclassicism

questions.question: A Guns N Roses song includes the lyric, Take me down to the very nice city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: During this period, Church was the major patron of music. That is why a great number of composers were associated with it. Just like composer Hildegard von Bingen, who was an abbess of a convent.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middle Ages

questions.question: During this period composers began to seek beauty through simplicity in music with only one music line.  Mozart and Beethoven created their masterpieces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Classical period

questions.question: Which of the following was not a great conductor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Claudio Brendel

questions.question: This music became popular in the mid 1900s. It was characterized by the use of very little musical material and repetition of patterns.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Minimalism

questions.question: Program music evolved during this period. This was music designed to describe special feelings, objects or even people. Tchaikovsky gave us the best example of program music - his Swan Lake is a story, danced on stage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Romantic period

questions.question: The musical elements used during this period were well defined and clear. The music uses fragments from other cultures or from European ethnic groups. Bela Bartok is one of the composers associated with this period.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Primitivism

questions.question: During this period the Italian madrigal and the French chanson were created as new types of music. Instrumental music became widely popular. Claudio Monteverdi was the leading composer of this time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Renaissance

questions.question: Fugue was perfected by Bach. The greatest example is in Toccata and Fugue. It was elaborated in this historical period.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baroque

questions.question: This music composition technique is characterized by recurring series of ordered elements which are manipulated to give a piece unity. Arnold Schoenberg made extensive use of this technique.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Serialism

questions.question: Which instrument made these men famous: Jascha Heifetz, Itzhak Perlman, Isaac Stern and Joshua Bell?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Violin

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Hits
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, rite, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which country music artist, known for the song Hello Darlin , died in 1993?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Conway Twitty

questions.question: Clay Walker performed the song Rumor Has It in 1997.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The theme music for 2001 A Space Odyssey  was composed by this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Strauss

questions.question: Who performed the song Straight Tequila Night in 1992?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Anderson

questions.question: This group was among the first artists to abandon punk in favor of the new wave.  Notable hits include Friend or Foe, Kings of the Wild Frontier and Goody Two Shoes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam  the Ants

questions.question: Who performed Dust on the Bottle in 1995?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: David Lee Murphy

questions.question: Wagon Wheels is a part of Symphony 9, From the New World, written by this famous composer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dvorak

questions.question: In 1982 this band scored a hit with Der Kommissar.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: After the Fire

questions.question: In what year did Tim McGraw and Faith Hill tie the knot?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1996

questions.question: Who performed the song Strawberry Wine in 1996?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deana Carter

questions.question: Steppin Out, Breaking Us In Two and Is She Really Going Out With Him? were big hits in the 1980s for this musician.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Jackson

questions.question: Who released the album Ropin the Wind in 1991?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Garth Brooks

questions.question: Which of the following was not written by Puccini?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Tell

questions.question: Which great 20th century composer wrote Rite of Spring?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Igor Stravinsky

questions.question: This bands 1982 album, Lexicon of Love, contained the hits Poison Arrow and The Look of Love.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ABC

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Band and Song
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, tubeway, reggae. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: In 2003 the band No Doubt recorded a successful cover version of the song Its My Life, originally recorded by this English new wave band in 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Talk Talk

questions.question: This artist is perhaps best known for his 1982 song She Blinded Me With Science.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Dolby

questions.question: By 1986 the new wave movement was beginning to decline; however, this musical team still scored a successful synthesizer hit with West End Girls.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pet Shop Boys

questions.question: This band is perhaps best known for their first single, a cover of the classic Burt Bacharach song (Theres) Always Something There to Remind Me.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Naked Eyes

questions.question: They are one of the longest-lived and most successful bands to have emerged from the New Wave era. Notable songs include: Just Cant Get Enough, People Are People, and Master and Servant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Depeche Mode

questions.question: One Thing Leads To Another was a successful single from this bands 1983 album, Reach the Beach.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Fixx

questions.question: After leaving the influential band Tubeway Army, this artist began a solo career with the hit single Cars in 1980.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gary Numan

questions.question: This reggae influenced band from Birmingham, England achieved chart success with Red Red Wine in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UB40

questions.question: This English artist had hits with New Song in 1983 and What is Love? in 1984.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Howard Jones

questions.question: This group recorded several successful synthesizer based songs including Doctor, Doctor and Hold Me Now.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thompson Twins

questions.question: Come On Eileen by this band was the biggest-selling British single of 1982.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dexys Midnight Runners

questions.question: Annie Lennox and Dave Stewart comprise this musical act formed in 1980, which has since sold over 75 million records.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eurythmics

questions.question: This groups 1982 album, The Hurting, contained the U.K. top 5 hits Mad World, Pale Shelter, and Change.  Their 1984 follow up LP was a much bigger success, going quintuple-platinum.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tears for Fears

questions.question: This band is generally known for their 1985 hit If You Leave for the movie Pretty in Pink, but had achieved substantial success in the U.K. prior to the soundtrack.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark

questions.question: The song featured in the sound clip was released by this artist in 1982 from their album After the Snow.  The song was included in the movie Valley Girl (1983).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Modern English

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Audio Clip
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 1989 song by The Bangles reached the #1 chart position in six different countries.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eternal Flame

questions.question: This husband and wife duo topped the dance chart in 1986 with the song featured in the audio clip.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nu Shooz

questions.question: The 1987 George Michael song featured in the audio clip was a track from which mega-selling album?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Faith

questions.question: Which British band released the hit Breakout in 1987?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Swing Out Sister

questions.question: What is the title of the song featured in the audio clip by Paula Abdul from her 1988 album, Forever Your Girl?

options.text: (Its Just) The Way That You Love Me

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Straight Up

questions.question: The song featured in the audio clip was a top ten hit for this duo, which consisted of a funk session musician and a Hispanic a cappella vocalist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sly Fox

questions.question: Name John Denvers fourth album, which was a breakthrough for him in the United States because it contained the single Take Me Home, Country Roads?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poems, Prayers and Promises

questions.question: This bands single Heart and Soul (featured in the audio clip) reached #4 in the US, and #1 in the UK charts in 1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: TPau

questions.question: The audio clip is from the intro to a top ten hit from this group consisting of three female vocalists.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Exposé

questions.question: Shattered Dreams was a popular US and UK hit for this band in 1987.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnny Hates Jazz

questions.question: This UK band scored a catchy minor hit in 1988 with their single Crash.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Primitives

questions.question: Kyrie and Broken Wings were both successful hits for singer and guitarist Richard Marx.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In the 70s and early 80s, heavy metal was gritty and hard-hitting (see AC/DC and Black Sabbath).  By the mid to late 80s, it had mutated into what is now called hair metal (see Warrant and Winger).  Which hair band released the song featured in the audio clip, easily recognizable by its keyboard intro?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Europe

questions.question: What popular folk group of the 60s and 70s recorded John Denvers song Leaving On A Jet Plane which went on to be their first, and only, number 1 hit?

options.text: The Clancy Brothers with Tommy Makem

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peter, Paul and Mary

questions.question: Dont Worry, Be Happy was the title of a popular song in 1988 by this artist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby McFerrin

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Lyrics and Song
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The following lyrics are from the first track of Led Zeppelins album, Houses of the Holy:

options.text: ything I wanted to know, Any place I needed to go
y little song that you know.
The Song Remains Are the same
The Song Never Ends the Same

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Song Remains the Same

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song, For Your Life:

options.text: by, fake with all your might

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: right

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins blues rock song Since Ive Been Loving You:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the best

questions.question: John Denver has been commonly referred to as The Poet of the ___________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Planet

questions.question: John Denver guest-hosted many times the TV show Late Night with David Letterman.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song, Sunshine Woman:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: little diamond

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song, Nadine:

options.text: I think I see her please let me off this bus.
Please stop ,she has given me a rush.
My dream women you must stop at once.
Conductor slow down your going to kill all of us.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I think I see her please let me off this bus.

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from The Rain Song, a love ballad by Led Zeppelin:

options.text: Speak to my heart of only we know.
Speak to me the words that dont come out right.
Speak to me throughout the darkened moon light
Speak to me only with your eyes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Speak to me only with your eyes

questions.question: Singer John Denver was also well known for his photographs of people and places.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song, Black Dog:

options.text: Watch out love, I cant keep away.
Watch your money, its slipping away.
Watch your honey drip, cant keep away.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Watch your honey drip, cant keep away.

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song All My Love, written by Robert Plant and John Paul Jones:

options.text: He is the feather that longs for wind.
He is a feather in the wind.
He is the wind between you and me.
He is the fire with out wind.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He is a feather in the wind.

questions.question: On what album, from 1971, did John Denver include his dramatic reading of a poem about the horrors of war, entitled The Box?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poems, Prayers and Promises

questions.question: What was the title of John Denvers song that included the line I spent a week there one day?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saturday Night in Toledo, Ohio.

questions.question: In early 1997, John Denver filmed an episode for the Nature series, centering on the natural wonders that inspired many of his best-loved songs. The show contained his last song which he composed while rafting along the Colorado River with his son and daughter. What was the title of the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellowstone, Coming Home

questions.question: Complete these lyrics from Led Zeppelins song Heartbreaker:

options.text: She dont long to know your name.
As it was so long ago

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: As it was so long ago

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Tune
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, babershop, hopes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Best of Times is Now is the rousing closing number of which Jerry Herman show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: La Cage aux Folles

questions.question: The song Tradition is the opening number of which hit show of the 60s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiddler on the Roof

questions.question: The lyrics of  Ramble On, a song from Led Zeppelins 1969 album Led Zeppelin II, are influenced by which epic high fantasy saga?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lord of the Rings

questions.question: Which Rogers and Hammerstein hit musical features the song Kansas City sung by a cowboy who returns from the big city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Oklahoma

questions.question: Which long running Broadway show opens with the song I Hope I Get It?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Chorus Line

questions.question: The song Whatever Happened to Class? was cut from the movie version of which Bob Fosse musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Which Fosse musical features a lawyer singing “Razzle Dazzle in order to con a jury?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: Carrie sings Mister Snow in which Rogers and Hammerstein show of the 50’s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carousel

questions.question: Leaning on a Lamp Post was sung in which popular musical of the 80s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Me and My Girl

questions.question: Which musical showcased the hauntingly beautiful song Angel of Music?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phantom of the Opera

questions.question: In which musical does the lovely Sunrise/Sunset number represent the parents’ hopes for their daughters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiddler on the Roof

questions.question: The babershop tune Lida Rose was sung in which Meredith Wilson musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Music Man

questions.question: In which Bennet show does Cassie sing What I Did for Love?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Chorus Line

questions.question: The tune The Music of the Night a major theme in which Weber musical?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Phantom of the Opera

questions.question: In which show did Marian sing Goodnight My Someone making a wish on the evening star?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Music Man
